item.title: Schrodinger's Equation
item.description: The Schrodinger equation is a partial differential equation that describes the behavior of a quantum system.

item.title: L'Hopital's Rule
item.description: L’Hopital’s rule is a method for evaluating limits of indeterminate forms.

item.title: Lorentz Transformations
item.description: Lorentz transformations are used to transform between inertial frames of reference.

item.title: Determinants of Matrices
item.description: The formula for the determinant of a matrix.

item.title: Double Angle Trig Identities
item.description: Formulas expanding the trigonometric functions of double angles.

item.title: Trig Angle Sum/Difference Identities
item.description: Formulas for the trigonometric functions of the sum and difference of angles.

item.title: Vector Projection
item.description: Formulas for the projection of a vector onto another vector and the perpendicular vector left over.

item.title: Green's Theorem
item.description: Green’s theorem is a formula that describes the relationship between certain closed path line integrals and line integrals.

item.title: Hooke's Law (Modulus of Elasticity)
item.description: Hooke’s Law and Modulus of Elasticity relate the stress and strain of a material.

item.title: Hooke's Law (Spring Constant)
item.description: Hooke’s Law and the Spring Constant relate the force and displacement of a spring.

item.title: Hyperbolic Functions
item.description: Definitions of the hyperbolic functions

item.title: Stokes' Theorem
item.description: Stokes’ theorem describes the relationship between the integral of the curl of a vector field over a surface to the line integral of the same field around the boundary of the surface.

item.title: Cross Product
item.description: The cross product is a common operation in linear algebra and beyond.

item.title: Divergence Theorem
item.description: The divergence theorem is a formula that describes the relationship between the divergence of a vector field and the surface integral of the field over a closed surface.

item.title: Dot Product
item.description: The dot product is a common operation in linear algebra and beyond.

item.title: Ampere's Law
item.description: Ampere’s law is a formula that describes the magnetic field produced by a current-carrying wire.

item.title: Gauss's Law
item.description: Gauss’s law is a formula that describes the electric field produced by a charge distribution.

item.title: Cosine Law
item.description: The formula relating the sides and angles of every triangle.

item.title: Definition of the Derivative
item.description: The definition of the derivative.

item.title: Pythagorean Trig Identities
item.description: A few identities involving sine, cosine, and tangent.

item.title: Cauchy's Integral Theorem
item.description: A theorem used for line integrals of complex functions.

item.title: Gravitational Potential Energy
item.description: The potential energy of an object in a gravitation field.

item.title: Kinetic Energy
item.description: The energy of motion.

item.title: Laplace's Equation
item.description: Laplace’s equation is a common partial differential equation

item.title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
item.description: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus

item.title: Pythagorean Theorem
item.description: Formula relating the lengths of the sides of a right triangle

item.title: Maclaurin Series for e^x
item.description: The Maclaurin series for e^x

item.title: Momentum (Newtonian)
item.description: The momentum of a body in Newtonian mechanics

item.title: Quadratic Formula
item.description: The formula for the zeros of a quadratic equation

item.title: Newton's 2nd Law
item.description: The law that describes the acceleration of an object in Newtonian mechanics.

item.title: Euler's Identity/Formula
item.description: One of the most amazing formulas in mathematics.

item.title: Trig functions in terms of e
item.description: Common trig functions in terms of e

item.title: Ideal Gas Law
item.description: The equation of state of a hypothetical ideal gas.

item.title: Ohm's Law
item.description: Ohm’s law states that the current through a conductor between two points is directly proportional to the voltage across the two points.
